cluster_relations.rel_desc: Using gestures in interactions can enhance the clarity of communication.
Using gestures in interactions can enhance the effectiveness of communication.
Stronger relationships are an enhanced state of general relationships.

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: result of improved communication/body language use

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Attending to facial expression cues enhances communication skills.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when individuals pay attention to subtle cues
qualifiers.ConditionExpression: paying attention to the subtle cues

remarks: Relation generalized from group of cues; exact marginal contribution of facial expressions alone is implied.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Attending to gesture cues enhances communication skills.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when individuals pay attention to subtle cues
qualifiers.ConditionExpression: paying attention to the subtle cues

remarks: Relation inferred symmetrically with facial expressions in the same clause.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Attending to posture cues enhances communication skills.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when individuals pay attention to subtle cues
qualifiers.ConditionExpression: paying attention to the subtle cues

remarks: Parallel to facial expressions and gestures.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Attending to facial expressions deepens understanding of others.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when individuals pay attention to subtle cues
qualifiers.ConditionExpression: paying attention to the subtle cues

remarks: Contribution of each cue type is inferred from group statement.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Attending to gestures deepens understanding of others.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when individuals pay attention to subtle cues
qualifiers.ConditionExpression: paying attention to the subtle cues

remarks: Symmetric inference with facial expressions and posture.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Attending to posture deepens understanding of others.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: when individuals pay attention to subtle cues
qualifiers.ConditionExpression: paying attention to the subtle cues

remarks: Parallel construction to other cue types.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject has a positive causal effect on the quality, effectiveness, or degree of the object.
args.justification: All these relations describe a positive, beneficial causal effect where attending to or using nonverbal cues (gestures, facial expressions, posture) increases clarity, effectiveness, communication skills, or understanding. Normalizing under a single predicate 'improves' avoids trivial variants like 'enhances' while preserving the same semantics.
args.remark: Causal direction is consistently from nonverbal cue or behavior to communication-related competence or understanding.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject represents a stronger, more resilient, or enhanced state of the same underlying relationship type as the object.
args.justification: This relation links 'stronger relationships' to generic 'relationships' as an enhanced state, not as a causal benefit on a separate variable. A dedicated predicate capturing an intensity/state refinement between closely related relationship states is more precise than reusing a generic improvement predicate used for skills or outcomes.

Each relation expresses that a behavior or cue has a beneficial causal effect on a communication-related outcome (clarity, effectiveness, skills, understanding). Grouping them under 'beneficial_effect_relation' captures this shared semantics at a class level beyond the specific predicate wording.

The relation compares two closely related relationship states, where the subject is a more intense or enhanced version of the object. This fits a class describing intensity or degree relationships between states of the same underlying concept.

All these edges denote that the presence or attention to nonverbal cues causes an improvement in communication-related outcomes. This is best captured as a causal group, specifically positive/beneficial causality.

The link between 'stronger relationships' and generic 'relationships' reflects a modified or enhanced state rather than a separate entity or a direct causal effect on a different variable. This is best modeled as a modification/intensity relation between states of the same concept.
